 2993: %% Test port conflict resolution with real services
 2994: test_port_conflict_resolution_integration(_Config) ->
 2995:     ct:pal("Testing port conflict resolution with real services"),
 2996:     
 2997:     % Create a real port conflict
 2998:     ConflictPort = 11100 + rand:uniform(50),
 2999:     
 3000:     case gen_tcp:listen(ConflictPort, [{reuseaddr, false}, {active, false}]) of
 3001:         {ok, ConflictSocket} ->
 3002:             try
 3003:                 ct:pal("Created conflict on port ~p", [ConflictPort]),
 3004:                 
 3005:                 % Configure service to use the conflicted port
 3006:                 PortConfig = #{
 3007:                     mcp_server => #{
 3008:                         preferred_port => ConflictPort,
 3009:                         port_range => {ConflictPort, ConflictPort + 10},
 3010:                         required => true
 3011:                     }
 3012:                 },
 3013:                 
 3014:                 application:set_env(erlvectordb, port_config, PortConfig),
 3015:                 
 3016:                 ok = port_manager:reload_config(),
 3017:                 
 3018:                 % Try to allocate - should detect conflict and use fallback
 3019:                 AllocResult = port_manager:allocate_ports([mcp_server]),
 3020:                 
 3021:                 case AllocResult of
 3022:                     {ok, PortInfo} ->
 3023:                         [ServiceInfo] = PortInfo,
 3024:                         AllocatedPort = maps:get(port, ServiceInfo),
 3025:                         
 3026:                         ct:pal("Conflict resolution successful: allocated port ~p instead of ~p", 
 3027:                                [AllocatedPort, ConflictPort]),
 3028:                         
 3029:                         % Verify it's not the conflicted port
 3030:                         case AllocatedPort =/= ConflictPort of
 3031:                             true ->
 3032:                                 % Test that the allocated port is actually usable
 3033:                                 case test_port_usability(AllocatedPort) of
 3034:                                     ok ->
 3035:                                         ct:pal("Fallback port ~p is usable", [AllocatedPort]),
 3036:                                         port_manager:release_ports([mcp_server]),
 3037:                                         ok;
 3038:                                     {error, Reason} ->
 3039:                                         ct:fail("Fallback port ~p not usable: ~p", [AllocatedPort, Reason])
 3040:                                 end;
 3041:                             false ->
 3042:                                 ct:fail("Port manager allocated conflicted port ~p", [ConflictPort])
 3043:                         end;
 3044:                     {error, {allocation_failed, Errors}} ->
 3045:                         ct:pal("Allocation failed as expected due to conflicts: ~p", [Errors]),
 3046:                         % This is acceptable if no fallback ports are available
 3047:                         ok;
 3048:                     {error, Reason} ->
 3049:                         ct:fail("Unexpected allocation error: ~p", [Reason])
 3050:                 end
 3051:             after
 3052:                 gen_tcp:close(ConflictSocket),
 3053:                 application:unset_env(erlvectordb, port_config)
 3054:             end;
 3055:         {error, eaddrinuse} ->
 3056:             ct:pal("Port ~p already in use by system - this creates a natural conflict test", [ConflictPort]),
 3057:             % Test with the natural conflict
 3058:             test_natural_port_conflict(ConflictPort);
 3059:         {error, Reason} ->
 3060:             ct:fail("Failed to create test conflict: ~p", [Reason])
 3061:     end.
 3062: 
 3063: test_natural_port_conflict(ConflictPort) ->
 3064:     % Test conflict resolution when port is already in use by system
 3065:     PortConfig = #{
 3066:         mcp_server => #{
 3067:             preferred_port => ConflictPort,
 3068:             port_range => {ConflictPort, ConflictPort + 10},
 3069:             required => true
 3070:         }
 3071:     },
 3072:     
 3073:     application:set_env(erlvectordb, port_config, PortConfig),
 3074:     
 3075:     try
 3076:         ok = port_manager:reload_config(),
 3077:         
 3078:         AllocResult = port_manager:allocate_ports([mcp_server]),
 3079:         
 3080:         case AllocResult of
 3081:             {ok, PortInfo} ->
 3082:                 [ServiceInfo] = PortInfo,
 3083:                 AllocatedPort = maps:get(port, ServiceInfo),
 3084:                 
 3085:                 case AllocatedPort =/= ConflictPort of
 3086:                     true ->
 3087:                         ct:pal("Successfully resolved natural conflict: got port ~p instead of ~p", 
 3088:                                [AllocatedPort, ConflictPort]),
 3089:                         port_manager:release_ports([mcp_server]),
 3090:                         ok;
 3091:                     false ->
 3092:                         ct:fail("Failed to resolve natural conflict - got same port ~p", [ConflictPort])
 3093:                 end;
 3094:             {error, _} ->
 3095:                 ct:pal("Allocation failed due to natural conflict - acceptable"),
 3096:                 ok
 3097:         end
 3098:     after
 3099:         application:unset_env(erlvectordb, port_config)
 3100:     end.
 3101: 
 3102: test_port_usability(Port) ->
 3103:     % Test that a port can actually be used for binding
 3104:     case gen_tcp:listen(Port, [{reuseaddr, false}, {active, false}]) of
 3105:         {ok, TestSocket} ->
 3106:             gen_tcp:close(TestSocket),
 3107:             ok;
 3108:         {error, Reason} ->
 3109:             {error, Reason}
 3110:     end.
 3111: 
 3112: %% Test service coordination and startup sequencing
 3113: test_service_coordination_integration(_Config) ->
 3114:     ct:pal("Testing service coordination and startup sequencing"),
 3115:     
 3116:     % Configure services with explicit startup order
 3117:     BasePort = 11200 + rand:uniform(50),
 3118:     PortConfig = #{
 3119:         rest_api_server => #{
 3120:             preferred_port => BasePort,
 3121:             port_range => {BasePort, BasePort + 10},
 3122:             required => true,
 3123:             startup_order => 1  % Should start first
 3124:         },
 3125:         mcp_server => #{
 3126:             preferred_port => BasePort + 20,
 3127:             port_range => {BasePort + 20, BasePort + 30},
 3128:             required => true,
 3129:             startup_order => 2  % Should start second
 3130:         },
 3131:         oauth_server => #{
 3132:             preferred_port => BasePort + 40,
 3133:             port_range => {BasePort + 40, BasePort + 50},
 3134:             required => true,
 3135:             startup_order => 3  % Should start last
 3136:         }
 3137:     },
 3138:     
 3139:     application:set_env(erlvectordb, port_config, PortConfig),
 3140:     application:set_env(erlvectordb, rest_api_enabled, true),
 3141:     
 3142:     try
 3143:         ok = port_manager:reload_config(),
 3144:         
 3145:         % Test coordinated startup
 3146:         Services = [mcp_server, oauth_server, rest_api_server],
 3147:         StartupResult = port_manager:startup_services(Services),
 3148:         
 3149:         case StartupResult of
 3150:             {ok, services_started} ->
 3151:                 ct:pal("Service coordination successful"),
 3152:                 
 3153:                 % Verify all services are started and have bound ports
 3154:                 {ok, StatusInfo} = port_manager:get_port_status(),
 3155:                 BoundServices = [maps:get(service, Info) || Info <- StatusInfo,
 3156:                                maps:get(status, Info) =:= bound],
 3157:                 
 3158:                 AllStarted = lists:all(fun(Service) ->
 3159:                     lists:member(Service, BoundServices)
 3160:                 end, Services),
 3161:                 
 3162:                 case AllStarted of
 3163:                     true ->
 3164:                         ct:pal("All services successfully coordinated: ~p", [BoundServices]),
 3165:                         
 3166:                         % Test that services are accessible
 3167:                         test_coordinated_services_accessibility(BoundServices),
 3168:                         
 3169:                         % Clean up
 3170:                         port_manager:release_ports(Services),
 3171:                         ok;
 3172:                     false ->
 3173:                         MissingServices = Services -- BoundServices,
 3174:                         ct:fail("Not all services started. Missing: ~p", [MissingServices])
 3175:                 end;
 3176:             {error, {startup_failed, Service, Reason, Details}} ->
 3177:                 ct:pal("Service startup failed for ~p: ~p (~s)", [Service, Reason, Details]),
 3178:                 % This could be due to port conflicts or other issues, acceptable in test environment
 3179:                 ok;
 3180:             {error, {port_allocation_failed, Reason, Details}} ->
 3181:                 ct:pal("Port allocation failed: ~p (~s)", [Reason, Details]),
 3182:                 % This could be due to port conflicts, acceptable in test environment
 3183:                 ok;
 3184:             {error, Reason} ->
 3185:                 ct:fail("Unexpected startup coordination error: ~p", [Reason])
 3186:         end
 3187:     after
 3188:         application:unset_env(erlvectordb, port_config),
 3189:         application:unset_env(erlvectordb, rest_api_enabled)
 3190:     end.
 3191: 
 3192: test_coordinated_services_accessibility(Services) ->
 3193:     % Test that coordinated services are accessible
 3194:     lists:foreach(fun(Service) ->
 3195:         case port_manager:get_service_port(Service) of
 3196:             {ok, Port} ->
 3197:                 ct:pal("Testing accessibility of coordinated service ~p on port ~p", [Service, Port]),
 3198:                 
 3199:                 case test_service_connectivity(Service, Port) of
 3200:                     ok ->
 3201:                         ct:pal("Coordinated service ~p is accessible", [Service]);
 3202:                     {error, Reason} ->
 3203:                         ct:pal("Coordinated service ~p not accessible: ~p", [Service, Reason])
 3204:                 end;
 3205:             {error, Reason} ->
 3206:                 ct:pal("Failed to get port for coordinated service ~p: ~p", [Service, Reason])
 3207:         end
 3208:     end, Services).
